fields.name: Reminding_text
fields.fieldText: By clicking the "Create ER Inquiry Case" button, emails will be sent to MoE Team, Principal of the school, IT contact of the school, Relationship manager and Network Engineer.

textTemplates.name: ERPrincipalEmailBody
textTemplates.text:
Kia ora {!Get_inquire_case.Secondary_Contact__r.FirstName},

We were recently made aware that your school's been experiencing network issues, which we know is frustrating. We're working with your IT provider to try and resolve these issues and have sent them an email requesting more information.

As the initial advice our Network Engineers shared with your IT provider hasn't improved your network performance to the desired level, we're now able to consider your school for prioritisation for Equipment Replacement. Once we have all the required information, including from your IT provider, the Ministry of Education will decide if your school is approved for prioritisation.

There are a maximum number of schools we can complete Equipment Replacement for each month and the schools who the Ministry approves for prioritisation are those in greatest need. It's important to remember there is no guarantee your school will be prioritised for Equipment Replacement - we're simply gathering information about your school's issues at this stage.

Once all the information has been gathered your School Relationship Manager will organise a meeting with yourself, your IT provider and an N4L Network Engineer to discuss next steps.

If you have any questions please reach out to your School Relationship Manager in the first instance.

Ngā mihi,
The team at Network for Learning
{!Get_Case.Case_Thread_ID__c}

Network for Learning
0800 LEARNING | info@n4l.co.nz

textTemplates.name: ERSurveyICTEmailBody
textTemplates.text:
Kia ora {!Get_inquire_case.ICT_Implementation_Contact__r.FirstName} ,

Thanks for reaching out to us about the issues {!Get_Case.Account.Name} has been experiencing - we know how frustrating it is.

We've begun the process for your Equipment Replacement prioritisation request. As the initial advice our Network Engineers shared with you hasn't improved your network performance to the desired level, we're now able to move you to the next phase of the prioritisation process.

Information needed
We need some information from you to support {!Get_Case.Account.Name}'s case for prioritisation, which you can provide at the form link below. To help us process the request as quickly as possible, please provide this information within 2 weeks of receiving this email. If you don't have this information please forward this email to the person who does.

Complete form

Please remember there is no guarantee that {!Get_Case.Account.Name} will be prioritised for Equipment Replacement - we're simply gathering information about their issues at this stage. There are a maximum number of schools we can complete Equipment Replacement for each month and the schools who the Ministry approves for prioritisation are those in greatest need.

Once we have all the information we need we'll organise a meeting with {!Get_Case.Account.Name}, an N4L Network Engineer and yourself to discuss next steps. This should take approximately 2 weeks from receiving your information.

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to contact our Customer Support team on 0800 LEARNING.

Ngā mihi,
The team at Network for Learning
{!Get_Case.Case_Thread_ID__c}

Network for Learning
0800 LEARNING | info@n4l.co.nz

textTemplates.name: MOEEmailTemplate
textTemplates.text:
Kia ora MOE Team,

We’d like to advise you that {!Get_inquire_case.Account.Name} is being considered for the Equipment Replacement programme. They logged an incident that our Network Engineering team has reviewed and the initial advice shared with the school hasn’t improved their network performance to the desired level - as such, we’re looking at prioritising them for Equipment Replacement.

The prioritisation request process has 3 phases:

  • Fix IT - We attempt to resolve the issues through the incident management process, SLA's are as agreed with the Customer Support helpdesk
  • Report IT - We gather the information to help inform the decision regarding prioritisation, SLA’s are agreed as 2 weeks, depending on customer response times.
  • Replace IT - We replace the equipment, SLA's are as agreed on the Equipment Replacement prioritisation programme

The school has now moved to the Report IT phase. A NEW inquiry case {!Get_inquire_case.CaseNumber} has now been created for this phase and we’ll share the final recommendation report with you once it’s complete.

If you have any other questions please contact the School Relationship Manager {!Get_User.Name} at {!Get_User.Email}.

Ngā mihi,
The team at Network for Learning
{!Get_Case.Case_Thread_ID__c}

Network for Learning
0800 LEARNING | info@n4l.co.nz

variables.description: The email address that the email is sent from. Note: this must be a verified Org-Wide Email Address
variables.name: EmailSentFrom

variables.description: The ID of the GetFeedback survey. This is the value in the URL after /r/ and before the question mark.
